data.text:
Herman Bentley, 91, of Sylvania, OH, passed away Tuesday, November 1, 2022, at Lakes of Sylvania. He was born December 15, 1930, in Pike County, KY, to parents Russell and Ida (Hall) Bentley. Herman was employed for more than 43 years as a Locomotive Engineer, with the B&O and CSX Railroads before retiring in 1992. He was proud to have served the United States Army during the Korean War. Herman enjoyed playing golf and sharing his many railroad stories.

He is survived by his wife Betty Jo Bentley; daughter Katherine (Bruce) Sanders; son Christopher Bentley; grandchildren Brittany, Paige and Tyler; great-grandchildren; Braelyn, Averie, Zander, Lincoln, and Everly; sisters Phyllis Murphy, Christine Keen, and Betty Spence. Herman was preceded in death by his parents; son Russell; 5 sisters and 5 brothers.

Friends may call at the Reeb Funeral Home, 5712 N. Main St. Sylvania, OH, Monday, November 7th from 11:00 AM until the Funeral Ceremony begins at 1:00 PM. Herman will be laid to rest at Toledo Memorial Park.

Those wishing to give memorials, in lieu of flowers, are asked to consider the First Apostolic Church, Toledo, where Herman has been a member since 1960, and served as a Deacon and Board Member for many years. Online condolences to reebfuneralhome.com
